8:
↓ Trading wisdom

You need to engrave this trading advice into your brain.

STOP. FORCING. TRADES!

You will only become a successful trader when you take only high-conviction trades.

Why?

Because only amateurs look for challenges and a high quantity of trades.

Professionals only look for easy and high-quality trades.

Losers get high from the action, and the pros look for the best odds.

In trading, the beauty is found in simplicity and conviction.

Remember, the goal of a successful trader is to make the best trades. 

Money is secondary.

The trader who focuses on becoming a better trader and takes high-conviction trades finds more success than the trader who trades frequently and chases money.
.
.

#trade
10:
Step 1 - You need education
Spend one hour a day studying one trading concept; SMC, classic patterns, trend lines, breakouts, and fake outs (PS they all work)

- Choose one market (Futures, Forex, Commodities)
- Create a demo account using ICMarketsLive and MT4
- Backtest and Paper trade the concept you’re learning
- Study effective risk management techniques 

Step 2 - Develop good trading habits
Plan a daily routine for optimal results in trading and life.

Steal mine:
- 6am wake up.
- 6-7am shower, brush teeth, make the bed, and get ready for the day.
- 7am sit down on charts with a coffee.
- 7-10am Analyse charts, study concepts, journal backtest, and track trades.
- 10am break.
- 10.15am-1pm gym and a healthy lunch.
- 1-4pm back on the charts studying.
- 4pm-9pm relax, dinner, other side hustles, work or business.

Step 3 - Train your mind
Spend an hour a day journaling, meditating, and/or deep breathing. Meditate on your morality to really put life into perspective and develop an appreciation for the little things.

Step 4 - Exercise 
Your health is your number one priority, without your health you are nothing. Take care of your health and your health will take care of you for the rest of your life.
Remember how you do one thing is how you do everything, so this means go hard in the gym and push yourself until failure.
Exercise will free your mind from the modern-day mental challenges we face. Do something hard to your body and you will be immediately taken out of your own head.
Having discipline outside the charts will lead to results on the charts.
